section_a.beneficiaries: Ww. The company’s activities will provide benefit to ... .. in particular, but not exclusively, theatre audiences, theatre practitioners, associated artists, educational establishments and students including those in primary, secondary, higher and further education, the elderly, refugees, communities who speak English as a second language in and around the East Midlands with an emphasis on those communities residing in Nottinghamshire. All those who wish to use the arts as a catalyst for debate and active participation in their community and society in general Version 4 - Last Updated on 24/08/2016

section_b.surplus_use: In the short term we expect that this will be reinvested in the Company. In the longer term it will be used for developing links with other organisations and communities and for supporting sustainable structures in the communities we work in.
